content.rendered:
What are Nurse Midwives?

Nurse Midwives are lisenesd healthcare professionals who specialize in reproductive health and childbirth.

Where do Nurse Midwives work?

  • Hospitals
  • Private practices
  • Public helath clinics

How much do Nurse Midwives make?

Based on real new grad salaries reported through Handshake, the median annual salary for Nurse Midwives is $91,000.

What majors are typically interested in becoming Nurse Midwives?

One’s major doesn’t necessarily determine their career, but these are some common majors of those who end up pursuing this career path.

  • Nursing majors
  • Biology majors
Search Nurse Midwives jobs on Handshake

Nurse Midwives skills and competencies:

On top of a relevant degree and formal training, here are some professional skills that can help aspiring Nurse Midwives succeed in their work:

  • Great evaluation skills
  • Strong organizational skills
  • Interpersonal skills

What are some common questions about Nurse Midwives?

Q: How do I become a Nurse Midwife?

A: Depending on the path you end up taking, there are two ways to become a Nurse Midwife. One is to finish a BA in Nursing and then do your postgraduate in Midwifery. The other is to do your BA in Midwifery.

excerpt.rendered: Learn about the average salary, relevant studies, related questions, and common path after college to becoming Nurse Midwives.
